intro: Hiraea fosteri, commonly known as the Foster's hiraea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hiraea fosteri is considered a species of conservation concern.
